intro: Scabiosa breviscapa, commonly known as the short-capped scabious, is a flowering plant native to central and southern Europe. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Scabiosa breviscapa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
